sentences.en: But Owen is not an understudy.
sentences.cn: 但是欧文不应该是替补演员.

sentences.en: Even though Sue is an understudy, she did a great job as the leading lady!
sentences.cn: 虽然苏是候补演员, 但是她演女主角演得真好! 你有听到谢幕时大家的掌声多大吧?

sentences.en: He was an understudy to Charlie Chaplin on a tour of the U.S.
sentences.cn: 他曾是查理•卓别林美国巡演的替角。

sentences.en: The leading player is ill. Let his understudy to appear on the scene.
sentences.cn: 主角演员病了, 让他的替角出场.

sentences.en: The star actor was ill, so his understudy had to alternate for him.
sentences.cn: 这位明星演员病了, 因而他的替角必须代他演出.

sentences.en: The understudy is substituted when the leading actor falls ill.
sentences.cn: “主角演员患病,由替角代替演出”.

sentences.en: The understudy was substituted when the leading actor fell ill.
sentences.cn: 主角演员患病,由替角代替演出.

sentences.en: The Vice - President acts as understudy to the President.
When the play's star broke her leg her understudy wept crocodile tears.
sentences.cn: 当这部剧的主演摔坏了腿时，她的替角流下了鳄鱼的眼泪。

sentences.en: When the star became sick, his understudy stepped into his part.
sentences.cn: 当这位电影明星生病时, 由他的候补演员担任他的角色.

sentences.en: While the star is recuperating from her illness, her role will be played by her understudy.
sentences.cn: 当明星正在休养恢复健康时，她的角色由修补演员代替。

trans.tran_cn: 预备演员，替角，代替之人
trans.tran_en: an actor who learns a part in a play so that they can act the part if the usual actor is ill
to be an understudy for a particular actor in a play
